title.narrative: ACE/Capacity building smallholders located in rural areas to improve access to structured markets

description.narrative: The Agricultural Commodity Exchange for Africa (ACE) is a non-profit commodity exchange platform that links farmers to markets. It works in a highly fragmented market plagued with information and infrastructure obstacles.The goal of this two-year project will be to ensure that rural farmers in Malawi gain access to storage finance markets and market information through rural warehouse receipt storage facilities. The project will target smallholders that are located within the catchment area of five rural s torage sites that have integrated the warehouse receipt system into their operations.ACE will work on increasing the utilization of the existing rural warehouses by the smallholder farmers in some or all of the following districts: Kasungu Nkhotakota Mchin ji Dowa and Dedza. The selection of the five warehouses will be based upon greatest potential for increased capacity.The project has strategically selected a multitude of operational structures reason being ACE would like to determine whether the uptake of the warehouse receipt system is affected by the farmer structure in place. For example farmers at Kafulu are organized into an association whereas famers at Clinton are organized according to the anchor farm model. Thus ACE would like to determine whether there is a difference in adoption between these operational structures.The project will 1) ensure that rural farmers gain access to storage finance markets and market information though rural warehouse receipt storage facilities and 2)?train and sensitise communities in target areas.The project is expected to reach out to 10000 smallholder farmers in the catchment areas of the selected rural warehouses out of whom 3000 will participate in the warehouse receipt system. Around 10000 MT of commodity is expect ed to be deposited on warehouse receipt system.The maximum FLC budget for the project is EUR 81000.
